question.body: Tension is to pulling from each end as compression is to _____________.

multiple_choice.choice: moving one end with the other fixed.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Moving does not necessarily alter the material like compression does.
Correct. Pushing the ends together compress a bone along its axis, which puts compressive force on it.
Incorrect. In fact, squeezing can lead to some degree of compression along the short axis of a bone, it produces a mainly tangiential stress of fibers. Therefore this is not the best answer.
Incorrect. This describes a rotational stress, which is more complex than a compressive stress

part.hint: Compression is a stress that alters (or potentially alters) the material, and is typically used to describe a stress along the long axis of a structure.

question.body: Tension is to collagen as compression is to _____________.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This answer is not specific enough as some components of the extracellular matrix resist tension, while others resist compression.
Incorrect. TCalcium by itself does not resist compression.
Correct. Microscopic hydroxyapatite crystals are embedded in collagen and organized to give bone its resistance to compression.
Incorrect. Phosphate by itself does not resist compression.

part.hint: Consider the role of extracellular matrix components in resisting tension and compression.

question.body: A deficiency in which of the following would lead to an increased probability of fracture:

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although true, this is not the best answer to this question
Incorrect. Although true, this is not the best answer to this question
Correct. Defects in any aspect of the microscopic structure of bone can lead to decreased strength and increased risk of factures.
Incorrect. Although true, this is not the best answer to this question.

part.hint: The bones of your body can experience stresses in multiple directions.
